monuments.name: Taj Mahal
monuments.description: A white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

monuments.name: Eiffel Tower
monuments.description: An iconic iron lattice tower in Paris, France, designed by Gustave Eiffel.

monuments.name: Great Wall of China
monuments.description: A historic series of fortifications built to protect China from invasions.

monuments.name: Statue of Liberty
monuments.description: A neoclassical sculpture gifted by France to the United States, symbolizing freedom.

monuments.name: Colosseum
monuments.description: An ancient Roman amphitheater used for gladiator contests and public spectacles.

monuments.name: Machu Picchu
monuments.description: Machu Picchu is an Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains in Peru, above the Urubamba River valley. Built in the 15th century and later abandoned, itâ€™s renowned for its sophisticated dry-stone walls that fuse huge blocks without the use of mortar, intriguing buildings that play on astronomical alignments and panoramic views. Its exact former use remains a mystery.
